item.title: Amy add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "We delight in the beauty of the butterfly, but rarely admit the changes it has gone through to achieve that beauty." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Amy add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Amy add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Amy add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Amy add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Let us accept truth, even when it surprises us and alters our views." -- George Sand

item.title: Amy add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Amy add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Amy add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Amy add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Amy add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Amy add a quote by Henry Adams
item.description: "A teacher affects eternity; he can never tell where his influence stops." -- Henry Adams

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Amy add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Amy add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "A woman has to live her life, or live to repent not having lived it." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Amy add a quote by Jane Goodall
item.description: "What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make." -- Jane Goodall

item.title: Amy add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Amy add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "Don't be seduced into thinking that that which does not make a profit is without value." -- Arthur Miller

item.title: Amy add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Amy add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Amy add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "We are all born mad. Some remain so." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Amy add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Amy add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that, and living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart. You are here to be swallowed up. And when it happens that you are broken, or betrayed, or left, or hurt, or death brushes near, let yourself sit by an apple tree and listen to the apples falling all around you in heaps, wasting their sweetness. Tell yourself you tasted as many as you could." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Amy add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Amy add a quote by Aaron Copland
item.description: "To stop the flow of music would be like the stopping of time itself, incredible and inconceivable." -- Aaron Copland

item.title: Amy add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "The longer I live, the more uninformed I feel. Only the young have an explanation for everything." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Amy add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Amy add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: Amy add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Amy add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "An adventure is only an inconvenience rightly considered. An inconvenience is only an adventure wrongly considered." -- G.K. Chesterton
